experiment-id.help: Experiment ID (Used to create the path where results are saved)

algorithm-id.help: Algorithm ID (Used to create the path where results are saved)

population-size.help: Population size (Number of individuals per generation)

terminate-generation.help: Set the termination criterion to the number of generation, and set the max value

terminate-evaluation.help: Set the termination criterion to the number of objective function evaluations, and set the max value

verbose.help: If true then display for each generation some information

is-probability-dont-care.help: If specified then use the don't care rate for the antecedent factory, otherwise compute it from antecedent num not don't care

antecedent-number-do-not-dont-care.help: Number of indices that are not 0 (which is don't care) in an antecedent. Used by the antecedent factory

dont-care-rt.help: Don't care probability for antecedent indices in antecedent factory

initiation-rule-num.help: Number of rules in Pittsburgh solutions in the initial population

max-num-rules.help: Maximum number of rules in Pittsburgh solutions

min-num-rules.help: Minimum number of rules in Pittsburgh solutions

antecedent-factory.help: Antecedent factory used for fuzzy rule generation. If crossover-type is hybrid then

objectives.help: List of the objectives. Accepted values: 'error-rate', 'rule-interpretation', 'num-rules', 'total-rule-length

is-multi-label.help: Must be specified if the dataset is a multi label one and not specified otherwise, which is the default

train-file.help: Path of the training dataset file

test-file.help: Path of the test dataset file

data-name.help: Dataset name. It's used to create the path where results are saved

no-output-files.help: Don't save results in files (plots, solutions, arguments...)

pretty-xml.help: Save results in a pretty XML file (i.e. formated with indentation)
